meanings.sent1: The fogeys in the neighborhood always wear suits and hats.
meanings.sent2: My grandpa is a fogey who prefers reading newspapers over using a tablet.
meanings.sent3: The fogeys at the party were the only ones dancing to the old music.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a fogey in a world of fast-paced technology.
meanings.sent5: The fogeys in the museum admired the classic paintings with nostalgia.

meanings.definition: To act in a manner characteristic of an old-fashioned or conservative person.
meanings.sent1: He fogeys around by insisting on writing letters instead of emails.
meanings.sent2: She fogeys about by always following traditional customs.
meanings.sent3: The young man fogeys his way through life, never embracing modern trends.
meanings.sent4: The company fogeys its approach to marketing, sticking to traditional methods.
meanings.sent5: The teacher fogeys through the lesson, using chalk on the blackboard.
